question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
I gifted a soft toy to my daughter.

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: To my daughter was gifted a soft toy by me.
option_2: A soft toy was being gifted to my daughter by me.
option_3: A soft toy is gifted to my daughter by me.
option_4: A soft toy was gifted to my daughter by me.
solution:
Solution:

The original sentence is in active voice and past tense:

  • Subject: I

  • Verb: gifted

  • Object: a soft toy (direct), to my daughter (indirect)

In passive voice, the object becomes the subject:

  • “A soft toy” becomes the subject,

  • Verb in past passive: was gifted,

  • “to my daughter” remains as the indirect object.

Correct passive construction:
➡ “A soft toy was gifted to my daughter by me.”

Option Analysis :

  • (a) – Incorrect word order; sounds unnatural.

  • (b) – Incorrect tense (past continuous), original is simple past.

  • (c) – Incorrect tense (present), original is in past.

  • (d) – ✅ Correct tense, structure, and voice.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in direct speech.
My son exclaimed with joy that it was an attractive site.

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: My son said, “What an attractive site it was!”
option_2: My son said, “What an attractive site it is!”
option_3: My son said, “It was an attractive site.”
option_4: My son said, “It is an attractive site.”
solution:
Solution: Option c is the correct answer.

Rules of Exclamatory Sentences.

  • Said + God! ---------------- exclaimed with sorrow.

  • Said + Hurray! ------------------- exclaimed with joy.

  • Said + Fi! /Ugh ----------------- exclaimed with despise/ disgust.

  • Said + Wow! --------------------- exclaimed with joy.

  • Said + Oh! ------------------------ exclaimed with surprise / regret.

The correct answer is: My son said, “What an attractive site it is!”

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Simran was plucking the flowers.

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: The flowers are plucked by Simran.
option_2: The flowers have been plucked by Simran.
option_3: The flowers will be plucked by Simran.
option_4: The flowers were being plucked by Simran.
solution:
Rule-:

Active to Passive: Tense never changes in Active to Passive Transformation.

  • Sub + v2 + Obj -------------------- Obj + was/were + v3 + Sub

  • Sub + was/were + v4 + Obj ---- Obj + was/were + being + v3 + by sub.

  • Sub + had + v3 + Obj ------------ Obj + had + been + v3 + by + Sub.

Thus, the correct passive voice is: The flowers were being plucked by Simran.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The seller shall dispatch the parcel soon to Chennai.

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: The parcel will be dispatched soon to Chennai by the seller.
option_2: The parcel might be dispatched by the seller to Chennai soon.
option_3: The parcel can be dispatched by the seller to Chennai soon.
option_4: The parcel may be dispatched by the seller to Chennai soon.
solution:
Active Voice to Passive Voice Rule-:

Sub + shall/will + v1 + object ----- Obj + shall/will + be + v3 + by + Sub.

Thus, the correct answer is: The parcel will be dispatched soon to Chennai by the seller.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
I remember my mother taking me to the stadium.

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: I remember being taken to the stadium by my mother.
option_2: My mother remembered me taken to the stadium.
option_3: I was remembered being taken to the stadium by my mother.
option_4: I was taken to the stadium by mother that I remembered.
solution:
In passive voice, the object of the active sentence becomes the subject of the passive sentence. The sentence "I remember my mother taking me to the stadium" is changed to "I remember being taken to the stadium by my mother," where the focus is shifted from the subject (my mother) to the object (me).

The correct option that expresses the sentence "I remember my mother taking me to the stadium" in the passive voice is:

I remember being taken to the stadium by my mother.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Doctors saved many lives during the pandemic.

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: Many lives were saved by doctors during the pandemic.
option_2: Many lives were being saved by doctors during the pandemic.
option_3: Many lives have been saved by doctors during the pandemic.
option_4: Many lives are saved by doctors during the pandemic.
solution:
In passive voice, the focus shifts from the subject (doctors) to the object (many lives). The action (saved) is expressed in the past tense because the original sentence is in the past tense ("saved").

The correct option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice is:

Many lives were saved by doctors during the pandemic.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The new sunshades have protected our windows during the rainy season.

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: Our sunshades have been protected by the new windows during the rainy season.
option_2: Our windows are being protected by the new windows during the rainy season.
option_3: Our windows have been protected by the new sunshades during the rainy season.
option_4: Our windows are being protected by the new sunshades during the rainy season.
solution:
In the passive voice, the object of the active sentence becomes the subject. In this case, "our windows" becomes the subject, and the action "have protected" is converted to "have been protected."

The correct auxiliary verb "have been" is used because the original sentence is in the present perfect tense ("have protected").

The correct option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice is:

Our windows have been protected by the new sunshades during the rainy season.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
They built a new house last year.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (10 Jan))
option_1: A new house was being built by them last year.
option_2: They had been building a new house last year.
option_3: A new house was built by them last year.
option_4: A new house is being built by them last year.
solution:
The correct answer is: A new house was built by them last year

Active Voice ------- Passive Voice

Subject + V2 + Object ------ Object + was/were + V3 + by + Subject

They built a new house last year. -------> A new house was built by them last year.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Perumal has given a challenging assignment to the newly admitted students.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (10 Jan))
option_1: A challenging assignment has been given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.
option_2: A challenging assignment will have been given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.
option_3: A challenging assignment was given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.
option_4: A challenging assignment had been given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.
solution:
The correct answer is: A challenging assignment has been given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.

Active Voice ----> Passive voice

Subject + has/have + V3 + Object ----> Object + has/have + been + V3 + by + subject

Perumal has given a challenging assignment to the newly admitted students. A challenging assignment has been given by Perumal to the newly admitted students.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The teacher will explain the lesson tomorrow.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (10 Jan))
option_1: The lesson is being explained by the teacher tomorrow.
option_2: The lesson was explained by the teacher tomorrow.
option_3: The lesson will be explained by the teacher tomorrow.
option_4: The lesson will have been explained by the teacher tomorrow.
solution:
The correct answer is: The lesson will be explained by the teacher tomorrow.

Active Voice Passive Voice

Subject + will/shall + V1 + object Object + will/shall + be + V3 + by + subject

The teacher will explain the lesson tomorrow. The lesson will be explained by the teacher tomorrow.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The team won the tournament after weeks of hard work and commitment.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (2 Nov))
option_1: The tournament was won by the team after weeks of hard work and commitment.
option_2: The tournament was being won by the team after weeks of hard work and commitment.
option_3: The tournament was winning by the team after weeks of hard work and commitment.
option_4: The tournament had been won by the team after weeks of hard work and commitment.
solution:
Active Voice ----- Passive Voice (In Simple Past):

Subject + Verb(second form) + Object ----- Object + was/were + Verb(3rd) + By + Subject

The team won the tournament after weeks of hard work and commitment. ------ The tournament was won by the team after weeks of hard work and commitment.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The rescue team could have completed the task if there had been uninterrupted power supply.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (2 Nov))
option_1: The task could have been completed by the rescue team if there had been uninterrupted power supply.
option_2: The task can have completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
option_3: The task could have to be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
option_4: The task could be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
solution:
Convert Active Voice into Passive Voice:

Subject + Could have + V3 + Object ----- Object + Could have + been + V3 + by + Object

The rescue team could have completed the task if there had been uninterrupted power supply. ------ The task could have been completed by the rescue team if there had been uninterrupted power supply.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
He is eating an apple.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (2 Nov))
option_1: He was eating an apple.
option_2: An apple was eaten by him.
option_3: He has been eating an apple.
option_4: An apple is being eaten by him.
solution:
The correct passive voice is: An apple is being eaten by him.

Active Voice into Passive Voice

Subject + is/am/are + V(ing) + Object ------ Object + is/am/are + being + V3 + Subject

He is eating an apple. ------> An apple is being eaten by him.
